title: Over $170 billion wiped off cryptocurrencies as market tanks on Mt. Gox bitcoin payout fears
content: Cryptocurrencies plunged on Friday as investors get anxious about the planned payout of nearly $9 billion to users of collapsed bitcoin exchange Mt. Gox.
summary: Cryptocurrencies plunged on Friday as investors get anxious about the planned payout of nearly $9 billion to users of collapsed bitcoin exchange Mt. Gox.

title: Outgoing UK PM Rishi Sunak quits as Conservative Party leader after crushing election defeat
content: Outgoing UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak will step down as leader of the Conservative Party after the Labour Party secured a landslide victory in the election.
summary: Outgoing UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak will step down as leader of the Conservative Party after the Labour Party secured a landslide victory in the election.

title: Can Israel's Iron Dome be overrun? System's capabilities in focus amid rising risk of war with Hezbollah
content: As Israel faces the prospect of a two-front war against Hamas and Hezbollah, military experts warn its advanced Iron Dome defense system could be overwhelmed.
summary: As Israel faces the prospect of a two-front war against Hamas and Hezbollah, military experts warn its advanced Iron Dome defense system could be overwhelmed.

title: Germany seals 2025 budget plan after weeks of tense negotiations
content: German government leaders have agreed on an outline of the country’s 2025 budget after intense negotiations, coalition leaders announced.

title: Goldman Sachs upgrades UK growth forecast after huge Labour election win
content: Goldman Sachs upgraded its growth forecast for the U.K. after the Labour Party’s landslide victory in the country’s general election.

title: Stocks, property, bonds, the pound: Here’s what a new Labour government means for investing in the UK

title: U.S. named the worst place for British families to move abroad. Here's why
content: The U.S. comes in last in a ranking of 28 countries, dragged down by high childcare costs, long work hours and lack of federally mandated paid parental leave.
summary: The U.S. comes in last in a ranking of 28 countries, dragged down by high childcare costs, long work hours and lack of federally mandated paid parental leave.

title: Trump ally Nigel Farage elected to British parliament for first time
content: After seven failed attempts, Nigel Farage has won a seat in the U.K.'s parliament.

title: Energy giant Shell to take up to a $2 billion impairment hit on Rotterdam, Singapore plants
content: Energy giant Shell on Friday said it expects to record a post-tax impairment hit of up to $2 billion mainly linked to its Singapore and Rotterdam plants.

title: Samsung shares hit over 3-year high after better-than-expected guidance on strong AI demand
content: Samsung said Friday it expects operating profit for the April to June quarter to be approximately 10.4 trillion won — a jump of about 1,452%.

title: Japan's Nikkei falters in volatile session after crossing 41,000 mark to hit fresh all-time high
content: Both the Nikkei and the the broad-based Topix in Japan faltered and dipped from their record highs earlier in the session.

title: Saks Fifth Avenue parent HBC to acquire Neiman Marcus Group in $2.65 billion deal
